pageTitle: Chris Shiflett & The Dead Peasants - All Hat & No Cattle (Vinyl LP) - Amoeba Music

textBeforeTable: Track Listing When you’re in one of the biggest bands in the world (in this case, Foo Fighters), how do you escape that band’s shadow when you want to release your own music? In the case of Chris Shiflett, he eschews the radio-rock of Dave Grohl and co. as well as his past as a punk guitarist with the straight-up honky tonk rock of Chris Shiflett & the Dead Peasants. His second album with the country-rock outfit the Dead Peasants is a beer-swillin’ set of jukebox jams about double dealin’ and woman stealin’. Though you needn’t know Shiflett’s other work to enjoy All Hat and No Cattle, as any classic country fan should feel at home here, those looking for Shiflett’s electrifying guitarwork will find it all over the place, as on the harmonic riffs of “Good Time Charlies,” sneaking some glam rock into traditional square-dance territory. His band are no slouches, either, imbuing the songs with reverence for AM country gold with steel guitar and saloon piano in “Guitar Pickin’ Man.” Pop a top and saddle up with All Hat and No Cattle. 07/29/2013 Amoeba Review Download CD, Also available in: SHIPS FREE in U.S. $18.98 BUY
